result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L. Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**12 days credit if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.
AODA and follow through with recommendations- can be completed at Institutional ATR.

Compliance with all rules and regulations of Wisconsin Resource Center (WRC) while in treatment there. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted. 
All stayed pending further order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L. Perkins

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 10:31 AM) Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater and Count 2- Criminal Trespass to Dwelling as Repeater. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Court withholds sentence in Count 1 and orders 12 months Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail with Huber, all stayed pending further order of the Court; AODA and follow through with recommendations- can be completed at Institutional ATR; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Compliance with all rules and regulations of Wisconsin Resource Center (WRC) while in treatment there; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 12 days credit, if revoked. 
Court orders on Count 2- Defendant provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs. 
Court orders any contraband is destroyed.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:35 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling.

9:32 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony L. Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Anthony L. Perkins. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant needs to be fingerprinted. 
Case is referred to Branch 1 to schedule an ARGN.
